00018 typedef std::vector<double> doubleVector;
00019 using tranSupport::softEquiv;
00020 using std::cout;
00021 using std::endl;
00022 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00023 int main(int argc, char *argv[]) {
00024    TESTER_INIT("VectorMath");
00025 
00026    int vecLength = 5;
00027    doubleVector vec1(vecLength), vec2(vecLength);
00028 
00029    for (int i = 0; i < vecLength; i++) {
00030       vec1[i] = i / 2.0;
00031       vec2[i] = (vecLength - i + 1) * 3;
00032    }
00033 
00034 // cout << vec1 << vec2 << endl;
00035 
00036    // ===== check the summation ===== //
00037    TESTER_CHECKFORPASS(softEquiv(tranSupport::vectorSum(vec1), 5.0));
00038    
00039    // ===== check the dot product ===== //
00040    TESTER_CHECKFORPASS(softEquiv(tranSupport::vectorDot(vec1, vec2), 45.0));
00041    
00042    // ===== check the distance ===== //
00043    TESTER_CHECKFORPASS(softEquiv(tranSupport::distance(vec1, vec2),
00044                                                  26.9722079185224, 1e-14));
00045 
00046    TESTER_PRINTRESULT();
00047    
00048    return 0;
00049 }
